text:
Linux RedHat 7.2, Jmeter 1.7 Beta, Java package j2sdk-1_4_0-beta3-linux-i386.
Jmeter freezes after "trigger seeding of SecureRandom". I've also tried the most
recent Jmeter build. I realize both Java and Jmeter are beta, but I thought I
would report this anyways.
creator: trek_11@yahoo.com
mstover1@apache.org
text:
Any idea what "trigger seeding of SecureRandom" might be referring to?  I 
wouldn't even know where to start....

I haven't seen this with the jdk 1.4.0 release on Windows, btw.

This was with 1.4 Beta, since the full release came out I will try to reproduce
this again on Linux. I'll try this on Tuesday.

Scot
creator: trek_11@yahoo.com
trek_11@yahoo.com
text:
Sorry, I just got to installing the new java and trying it again. It is still
happening. I try to load a certificate using the SSL Manager and after I type in
the keystore password I get this:

KeyStore Type: PKCS 12
JmeterKeyStore Location: /home/scot/src/jakarta/jakarta-jmeter-1.7/bin/www-test.p12
JmeterKeyStore type: class org.apache.jmeter.util.keystore.DefaultKeyStore
class org.apache.jmeter.util.keystore.DefaultKeyStore
KeyStore Type: JKS
TrustStore Location: 
TrustStore type: class org.apache.jmeter.util.keystore.DefaultKeyStore
trigger seeding of SecureRandom


After the "trigger seeding of SecureRandom" it becomes unresponsive (it never
seems to come back, I've waited 30 minutes).

Scot

I have not tested this with a recent version of the JDK.
If you experience problems with the seeding of SecureRandom,
try a test program that merely initializes SecureRandom.

If it also locks up, you have a JDK problem, and cannot
be fixed by us.  You will have to bug Sun, or try the
Blackdown JDK which tends to be better for Linux anyway.
creator: bloritsch@apache.org
trek_11@yahoo.com
text:
I found the problem. The default random device with the 1.4 SDK under Linux is
/dev/random. Once I changed it to /dev/urandom the problem went away. You can do
this in java.security or with 

-Djava.security.egd=file:/dev/urandom

Scot

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
